definitions.usage_note: 及物动词。指从束缚、压迫、监禁或困难中使人或事物获得自由，常用于政治、军事、社会解放等语境。

sentences.en: The army liberated the city from enemy occupation.
sentences.zh: 军队从敌人占领下解放了这座城市。

sentences.en: Education can liberate people from ignorance and poverty.
sentences.zh: 教育能使人们摆脱无知和贫困。

sentences.en: The prisoners were liberated when the prison was stormed.
sentences.zh: 监狱被攻占时，囚犯们获得了释放。

collocations.explain: 常用搭配，后接束缚或压迫的来源

sentences.en: They fought to liberate their country from colonial rule.
sentences.zh: 他们为从殖民统治下解放国家而战斗。

sentences.en: Allied forces liberated Paris in August 1944.
sentences.zh: 盟军于1944年8月解放了巴黎。

free.diffs: free 更日常；liberate 常带政治或重大意义

sentences.en: The activists worked to free political prisoners.
sentences.zh: 活动人士致力于释放政治犯。

release.diffs: release 侧重松开、放走；liberate 侧重从压迫中解放

sentences.en: The hostages were released after negotiations.

etymology.origin: 源自拉丁语 liberāre（使自由），来自 liber（自由的）。
etymology.history: liber 意为“自由”，liberāre 意为“使自由”，经法语进入英语。

sentences.en: Freedom of speech is a fundamental liberty.
sentences.zh: 言论自由是一项基本自由权。

sentences.en: The liberation of the country was celebrated nationwide.
sentences.zh: 全国的解放受到举国欢庆。

common_mistakes.explain: liberate 后接 from，表示“从...中解放”，不用 of。

mnemonics.content: liber-（自由）+ -ate（使...）→ 使自由 → 解放、释放。
